modules.description: This module implements client-side communication over Windows Named Pipes using Lwt for asynchronous I/O. It provides functions to connect to a named pipe server and to convert the connection into a file descriptor for lower-level operations. Concrete use cases include inter-process communication (IPC) between a client application and a named pipe server on Windows systems.

This module implements named pipe servers on supported platforms, allowing creation of a named pipe at a specified path and handling client connections. It provides operations to wait for a client connection, flush write buffers, disconnect a connected client, and destroy the server. Concrete use cases include inter-process communication on Windows, such as coordinating between a service and its clients or implementing local RPC mechanisms.

Implements server and client functionality for Windows Named Pipes using Lwt for asynchronous communication. Works with file descriptors and Lwt threads, enabling inter-process communication between services and clients on Windows. Used for scenarios like local RPC, service coordination, and low-latency IPC between related processes.
